intro: Graphardisia lewisii, commonly known as Lewis's graphardisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
